alert.note: Alert for Brown; Marathon; Menominee; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 10:39PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Brown, northern Portage, southeastern Marathon, southeastern Menominee, Waupaca, southern Oconto, Outagamie and Shawano Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1036 PM CDT, radar and trained weather spotters reported clusters of strong thunderstorms over parts of central and northeast Wisconsin. The strongest storms were located in northern Portage County. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and hail up to nickel size. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Green Bay, Appleton, Stevens Point, Shawano, Waupaca, Kaukauna, Little Chute, New London, Kimberly and Clintonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized urban flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Marathon; Menominee; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca
